column1: Pecan Pumpkin Pie Dessert Pizza with Maple Whipped Cream^"http://www.foodista.com/recipe/YBRFWHCH/pecan-pumpkin-pie-dessert-pizza-with-maple-whipped-cream"^"https://spoonacular.com/recipeImages/Pecan-Pumpkin-Pie-Dessert-Pizza-with-Maple-Whipped-Cream-655525.jpg"^"brown rice
column25: 1 corned beef or beef brisket (about 3 pounds)
column26: 3 1/2 cups Swanson® Beef Broth or Swanson® Beef Stock
column30: trimmed and cut into 6 wedges (about 2 pounds)
column46: ¼ cup white wine (I used sauvignon blanc)
column68: 1 Mama Mary's Mini Original Pizza Crust
column121:
pumpkin pie spice"^"
  1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees.
  2. Melt 1/2 of the butter and 1 tbsp brown sugar in a small skillet.
  3. Brush onto on side of pizza crust.
  4. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 3 minutes.
  5. Meanwhile
column122:
add the rest of butter and 1 tbsp brown sugar to the skillet again.
  • Once it is melted add pecans and stir.
  • Cook for 2-3 minutes over medium until pecans are toasted and coated in sugar. Remove from heat.
  • Take crust out of oven and spread pumpkin pie filling evenly on top.
  • Sprinkle with pumpkin pie spice.
  • Remove pecans from butter mixture and sprinkle evenly on top of pizza.
  • Bake for 7 more minutes.
  • For Maple Whipped Cream: Using a cold bowl and beaters (I put mine in the freezer for about 30 minutes before using) beat heavy cream and maple syrup on high until stiff peaks form.
  • Remove pizza from oven. Cut into 4 pieces. Top with a dollop or two of whipped cream and serve!
    • "
